text: all around the planet since we last spoke ;)
ahah good for you! how are you finding it?
great ;) (k)ubuntu is a good distribution of linux
used Fedora, shortly debian, then Ubuntu,  had some issues filesystem errors+network...concluded it was my mainboard...so used XP during two mpnths
you made a good choice (either this or Mepis)..
now with new mobo (old one was nforce2ultra) VIA KT600  rocks!
ahah, well you're still using Debian now..
hehe KT600 is a good board
thanks, I met Jono Bacon at last years Blender Conference, very shortly we spoke, he tipped me about Ununtu then :D
yes :)  but I am getting hang of 'debian behavior' now
apt is pretty addictive.. i've been a junkie for around 7 years ;)
and of course you still use Blender ?
no i haven't... i'm still hanging on 2.36
for a long while I actually wondered where you went, didnt see you around in blender channels
i have been working flat out. teaching..
and now mesh displist is refactored...even faster SubSurf now
i've been getting into teaching blender. with a couple of days of hand-holding the kids love it.
they pay you all over world for you to teach ? :O
I can hand you a compile if you want
hey best you upload it. this machine is firewalled to the roof. then msg me.
thanks btw.. it will save me an hour..
sure.. downloading the source, grabbing the libraries and compiling..
dropped out the other day, i was on a borrowed access point if you know what i mean ;)
got issues here...so I had to re-install system, running a fresh Ubuntu now
heh...yes you just vanished like that
long story...can take it PM then (if)
i tried it some 5 years ago and haven't since.
sorry i dropped out last night. had to take my gf to the airport.
set the 'draw while drag'  to false :)  so now I see this wire
hmm odd. well i don't use gnome or KDE here, so on the DE front i'm not very helpful. naturally #gnome could be a good place to resolve fiddly details.
but I dunno...it feels kde in kubuntu have some glitches still, I might be wrong, but I rather run a stable system than more experiment (sorrry for that, but I feel it like that)
true...will do it ....but my nose is dripping so much.... ack...
that's wise. as far as KDE distributions are concerned, there is nothing better than Mepis. i've just installed it on many machines and it is very solid.
Ubuntu however really does pull off gnome very well.
now and then yes, anything new ?
afterwards I knew who he is :D
for some weird reason, Blender Conferences drawn some of the most interesting people ! :)
the year before...do you know who were there and who I by chance shook hands with :O ?
hehe...had a shot chat with him...he didnt even say he had been up to space!
whole blender coders jawdropped the week after
and why was he at the blender conference?
he talked about Python and the work along with Blender
so he works with blender does he?
what I know is that he like that language
the Python API for blender is excellent. i was revisiting it again today.
maybe...dont remember...but I wouldnt be surprised
aah...I dont know much about python, maybe I am lazy or just stupid artist
so when do you need 3d work help :P ?
so you are here helping out ? :)
not really, just dropped in to see how the most popular Desktop Distro of linux is going ;)
btw,,,how does the game development go for you ?
good, today working alot with http://ogre3d.org
today coding work, but only so that i can get models and events setup in the game engine
nice...can I ask what it is for ?
for a MMORPG project here at the itu.dk
though if i'm looking for an IP then it's slower.
you can run openbox (a great light window manager) in gnome. that will speed things up alot.
i'll find the link. it's a great window manager. http://icculus.org/openbox/2/
you can do some very nice things with the text and rendering in openbox http://icculus.org/openbox/2/shots/full/mwil-sshot.png
aah ok...but about tools , menus etc ???
well it just picks up the debian menu. you can use gnome, however. so you have the gnome panel, gnome menu and gnome tools but just use a wm much faster and lighter than metacity/sawfish
apt-get install openbox and then to try 'killall <yourwindowmanager> && openbox' in a terminal
it will be dramatic for a second or two ;)
what about open apps and windows ?
they /*should*/ accept the new wm and not die like lambs..
aah...the command to try...but it isnt default....until ???
hmm not sure. that's one nice treat about KDE
hold on tight, here we go ! :)
it went faster than a second !
you can alt-leftmousedrag and move the window around
you can however create those files and then enter the above line. 'touch .xinitrc' && echo 'exec openbox' >> .xinitrc'
but I would like to able to change modifier key
dunoo yet...but now the mouse+modifier key is better ;)
hit ALT-mousewheel in a window and drag
hmm well i can't remember what the resize button is. use a text editor to view .config/openbox/rc.xml or similar all the bindings are in there
also install obconf the openbox configurator
hard for me to remember the shortcuts ..
is there also a for waimaea as for openbox ?
is there any menutool for openbox ?
i switched because of both terminal work and modelling in blender.

why don't you ensure fazer has your same setup? he has an ~/.xsession file that he might want to remove and perhaps mirror what you have in ~/.xinitrc. i get the feeling he wants a bit of gnome and openbox, like you (a sensible choice).
he is too fast for us
he should be more gentle and have more patience
have conviced my sister to install Linux instead of Win98 on her comp, problem is...she wont get adsl and she uses 56k modem that is badly supported...I know, I tried !
hmm if it's an external modem it's usually ok.
not it isnt...my Lasat 56k flex....didnt work as it should either even if it was detected and did the dial
i know that the non-freeish Mepis has support for a whole bunch of evil internal winmodems.
so now I dont know how to solve it...it seems as the ISP doesnt like the commands...
hmm, i'd take thoreauputic's advice and buy her an external in a bunch of..... daffodils
uuuuh ?  I already have a external modem...my own lasat
you could use the usb cable from the external modem to tie the flowers in a bunch.
hmmm you mean a new USB phonemodem would work better than an old lasatmodem ?
usb modems work well in linux generally speaking.
though if the modem is detected but you can't connect your ISP then of course check the dial options and user/pw
you're right, i used wvdial back in the day to get mine up and running. thankfully those times are over.
can you tip any good model/brand ?
well if your serial modem is working don't touch it
it is detected instantly by Ubuntu...problem is however the settings for the ISP...dunno how to fix those
thoreauputic makes me feel like i've been lucky with usb modems.
hmmm tone I guess?  cant remember the differences
fine thanks...back to gnome...but maybe I already told you that...and also , tweaking my character I showed you before
I can show a bit later when I have done some nice updates
yeah do that.. i'd be interested
great! :D    I also bought & watched 'The Incredibles' DVD today
now I know why character shall not have a cape ;)
i'm considering buying a tv card, somewhat out-of-the-media-loop lately.
yes, for my laptop. so i can watch TV on my box.
my brother did that today, pinnacle
hmm.. well many seem to be perfectly linux compatible.
what's the DKK to SEK these days?
tell what which you get next time...I have also been thinking of it, even though I got tv less than 2 metres to the right ;)
about 1.25 I think  ( DKK more worth than SEK)
sorry , been away for a few minutes...had some troubles over at elYsiun :-\
i have to go. 30 students to teach tomorrow..
a user that annoyed other, spammed and hijicking other threads
oh ! :)  have a nice time...see you
see you too. keep up the good work at elysiun. my students are hanging out there this week ;)
good good...I got vacation myself :)  went to IKEA today
been thinking to go to Copenhagen before it ends
how to find you? Yellow pages? :P
look me up at the itu.dk is best. or better mail me a couple of days before you arrive.
that would might be now then!
been thinking of going friday before lunch
night, mail me before you arrive. a bit of notice is good. i'm teaching all day.
spreading the word about Ubuntu were I live :)
it's time for me to leave
no.. too tired to be very useful today.
soon 2 weeks vacation, take each day as it come

yep still working in denmark. just off for my girlfriends festival
